questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT
-

A company is evaluating Microsoft 365.

Select the answer that correctly completes the sentence.

//IMG//

discussion.content: This was in the exam on 3rd April 23

Manager insights provide much-needed insight into work behaviors within your team that may cause stress and burnout. With access to this information, managers are empowered to nip unhealthy work patterns in the bud before they get out of hand (e.g., ongoing after-hours work, meetings overload, insufficient focus time). By identifying these patterns early, managers can assist their teams in finding a balance between productivity and well-being.

questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT
-

A company is evaluating ways to improve their productivity by using Microsoft 365.

You need to determine the correct productivity feature.

Select the answer that correctly completes the sentence.

//IMG//

discussion.content: Creating a new Exchange throttling policy in Microsoft 365 is not typically considered an example of information governance. Throttling policies in Exchange are primarily used to control the amount of resources a user or application can consume to prevent performance issues and ensure fair resource usage within the Exchange environment. These policies are more related to performance and resource management rather than information governance. YES,YES, NO

Creating a new exchange throttling policy is an example of information governance in Microsoft 365. You can set throttling policy on an Exchange server by using the Set-ThrottlingPolicy and Set-ThrottlingPolicyAssociation cmdlets. You can create and remove non-default throttling policies by using the New-ThrottlingPolicy and Remove-ThrottlingPolicy cmdlets1. all 3 are YES

comments.content: I don't see how it is information governance. Throttling is about availability

questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT
-

Instructions: For each of the following statements, select Yes if the statement is true. Otherwise, select No.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

//IMG//

HOTSPOT
-

A company is evaluating Microsoft 365 Apps.

You need to describe the capabilities in Microsoft 365 Apps.

Select the answer that correctly completes the sentence.

//IMG//

choices.C: Report on cloud-based security event information.
choices.A: Set up and preconfigure new Windows devices.

discussion.content:
A. Set up and preconfigure new Windows devices: Microsoft Endpoint Manager enables IT administrators to easily set up and preconfigure new Windows devices with custom settings, security profiles, and apps. This allows for faster onboarding of users and reduces the amount of time spent on manual configuration.

D. Manage cloud-based mobile devices: Microsoft Endpoint Manager provides the ability to securely manage and protect a variety of mobile devices, including iOS, Android, and Windows devices. IT admins have the ability to manage mobile devices from a single console, enabling them to easily deploy apps and profiles, enforce security policies, and monitor device usage.

E. Deploy on-premises desktop apps: Microsoft Endpoint Manager allows IT administrators to easily deploy applications to on-premises devices and ensure that the applications remain up to date. This helps to ensure that users have access to the latest versions of the applications they need, reducing the need for manual installations and updates.

Selected Answer: ADE
I will go with 

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/solutions/empower-people-to-work-remotely-manage-endpoints?view=o365-worldwide

hmm well I think the monitoring of security event is a function of Defender for Endpoint, but of course you can monitor compliance and conditional access events. I was first for ACD but maybe I'll go ADE at the test and maybe only get 2 points.

comments.content:
C. Report on cloud-based security event information: This capability was selected because it is a critical capability for organizations that are moving to the cloud. Microsoft Endpoint Manager can be used to collect and report on cloud-based security event information, so that organizations can identify and respond to security threats quickly. (see link above)

E. Deploy on-premises desktop apps: This capability was not selected because it is not a primary strength of Microsoft Endpoint Manager. While Microsoft Endpoint Manager can deploy on-premises desktop apps, there are other tools that are specifically designed for this purpose.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: ADE
ADE reporting is not related to endpoint manager
Report on cloud-based security event information has nothing to do with endpoint manager
The correct answers are A , D and E

Selected Answer: ACD
answer E could also be, but it must be taken into account that these are arguments to convince the stakeholders.
Source for these 3 ? Intune can deploy apps as well and it's part of MEM

questions.question_text:
You are an IT director that is evaluating the capabilities of Microsoft Endpoint Manager.

You need to present the capabilities to key stakeholders.

Which three capabilities should you present to the stakeholders? Each correct answer presents a complete solution.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
